intro: Seseli montanum subsp. carvifolium, commonly known as mountain seseli, is a flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and compound leaves with finely divided, aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to regions of Europe and is often found in mountainous and alpine habitats. Seseli montanum subsp. carvifolium is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in traditional medicine.
